title.narrative: PA contribution to Chad RRM via Sida HPA

description.narrative: General objective: Contribute to reducing morbidity and mortality due to acute malnutrition in the districts of N'Djamena facing the nutrition crisis. Specific objective: Improve access to services and basic knowledge in relation to water, sanitation, hygiene and nutrition for the communities and households affected by the nutrition crisis. Result 1: Water Sanitation and Hygiene (WaSH) at the Therapeutic Feeding Units (TFUs) and Ambulatories Nutrition Centres (ANCs) (Oxfam): Improved hygiene and care conditions at nutrition facilities. Oxfam will work in the community in the 7th and 9th arrondissements and at 10 healthcare facilities as well as the TFU at the Mother and Child hospital. Activities: Distribution of 2,600 WaSH kits to malnourished child -mother pairs and to pregnant or lactating women (PLW) These WaSH kits will only be distributed to malnourished child -mother pairs admitted to the TFUs and ANCs targeted by Oxfam. The kits will comprise: 6 x 200g bars of soap, 1 litre of bleach and 1 kettle. The kits will not be distributed when the mother -child pair is admitted to the care facility, as measures will be taken at the TFUs and ANCs to improve access to chlorinated water and handwashing with soap. The WaSH kits will be issued to these pairs when they leave the TFU/ANC with the aim of enabling the mothers to continue the good practices of chlorinating drinking water and handwashing with soap in their respective households. The other reason for distributing these kits when they leave the TFU/ANC is also that, if they receive the kits when they are first admitted to the facility, some mothers do not stay for the full course of treatment of their malnourished children. For polygamous households, the kit will be given to the mother of the malnourished child admitted to the TFU.
